con:part.con:content:
ItemID: The item barcode

ReturnDate: The due date applied to the checkout. Optional, if staff chooses to override the default due date

]]> ItemBranch: The item's current Branch
DestinationBranch: The Branch to which the item is bound, if check in causes it to go in transit.
PatronID: The unique patronID: The patron for whom the transaction was resolved. For Charged items, this is the returning patron id. For items Hold Intransit, this is the requesting patron id.
DueDate: The date when the cleared transaction was due. Can be blank.
CheckoutDate: The date when the cleared transaction was created or last updated.
ReturnDate: The date the item was marked as returned. Will reflect the date if no override was passed in with the request.
ItemStatusDate: The date the current item status was applied. Always today's date.
Fines: Overdue fine amount posted as a result of returning an Overdue or Lost item.
Information: Repeatable field that will contain information about the transaction, which can include the status of the item after clearing the transaction (e.g. InTransit), the state of the item prior to check in, (e.g. Overdue, NotCharged), and an indication that fines were posted, if the amount of the Fines element of the response is greater than 0 (e.g. Fines Posted).
TransactionID: The unique transaction identifier; returned when the item will fill a hold at check-in.
]]>
Alias: The staff alias of the user completing the transaction
DueDate: The due date applied to the checkout. Optional, if staff chooses to override the default due date

ItemID: The item barcode

PatronSearchID: The actual patron ID, alternate ID or GUID to be searched

PatronSearchType: The type of search to be performed (patron ID, alternate ID or patron GUID)

Override: Optional boolean value that can be included in the request to force a checkout that would be expected to fail under normal conditions due to charge limits being encountered at the patron, branch, location, or media level. True will override the limit, and allow the checkout, False will continue to honor the limit, and prevent the checkout. Default behavior, if the Override value is not included in the request, is equivalent to False - if a limit is encountered the checkout will fail.

]]>
ResponseStatuses: The start position of the results (if supplied in the request)
ItemTitle: Item title
FineAmount: The amount, if any, of the patron's fine
Magnetic: A boolean indicating if the item is magnetic
Charge-on-Charge: A boolean indicating if the item is a charge on charge
DueDate: Due date of the item checked out
ChargeLimit: In the event that the checkout fails due to a charge limit being encountered at the patron, branch, location, or media level, the numeric limit will be returned for informational purposes. Charge Limit will not be returned for successful checkouts, or those that fail for reasons other than a charge limit.
Branch: The branch number associated with the item’s current branch.
Location: The location number associated with the item’s current location.
Media: The media number associated with the item.
Borrower Type: The borrower type number associated with the patron.
]]>
InstitutionCode: 3 or 4 digit code indicating the Institution being used

StationID: The ID of the terminal/machine being used

StaffID: The ID of the employee submitting the request. Valid ID required for resetPIN.

EnvBranch: Branch Code indicating the Branch being used; required for CheckInItem, CheckoutItem, and createSuggestion. Can be used optionally with getPatronSummaryOverview to limit counts returned to transactions associated with items held by, or fines and fees written at, the given Branch code. Default behavior, if the EnvBranch is excluded, is to return counts for all transactions.

DebugMode: Whether or not the request should be submitted in debug mode

ReportMode: Whether or not the request should be submitted in report mode; implemented and required for CheckInItem, CheckOutItem, and updatePatronUserDefinedFields. If True, information about the attempted transaction will be returned, but the transaction will not be completed. If False, the transaction will be completed.

Projection: The level of detail for each result in the response

RequestOrigin: The feature from which the request was initiated; required for UpdateItem. Limited to 12 characters

]]> This element contains the different levels of detail available for certain results (such as Title or Branch)<br/><br/> Retrieve the complete detail for each result in the response Retrieve a subset of the detail for each result in the response Retrieve a small, optimized subset of details for web performance
StartPos: Beginning location within the result set where records should be returned (ie if the result set contains 50 records, return the records beginning with the 10th record). Cannot be used in conjunction with FollowOnBrowseToken

FollowOnBrowseToken: When conducting follow-on browses, this token specifies the next block of results to return. Cannot be used in conjunction with StartPos

NoOfRecords: The maximum number of results to return in the response
]]>
Code: A numeric code indicating whether a request was successful or not

Severity: The level of importance of the response status

ShortMessage: A brief description of the response status

LongMessage: A more detailed description of the response status (optional)

Resolution: A message indicating what actions must be taken to fix an invalid/failed request

]]>
StartPos: The start position of the results (if supplied in the request)

FollowOnBrowseToken: The token required to retrieve the next block of results for a follow-on browse

NoOfRecords: The number of results contained in the response

MoreRecords: A boolean indicating if additional results are available

TotalHits: The total number of records returned by a query (the response typically contains a subset of the total number of records found)
EstimatedTotalHits: The estimated total number of records returned by a query
]]> Message: Extra information<br/><br/> MissingIDs: List of Missing IDs<br/><br/>
BID: The bid

ModDate: The last modified date of the corresponding bid

]]> This element contains the available catalog search types<br/><br/> Searches words from name headings without regard to word order. Returns a single alphabetical listing of all authority headings including name, subject, series and uniform title. Response also includes a follow on token for paging, as well as "Titles For Heading" tokens. Returns an alphabetical listing of name headings showing the number of bibliographic records for each heading as well as authority information. Personal names must be searched with surname first. Response also includes a follow on token for paging, as well as "Titles For Heading" tokens. Returns a list of bibliographic records sorted by title-level call number, starting with the call number searched (or the call number following closest). For Call Number searches set up to search specific call number types (i.e. Dewey Abridged, Dewey Unabridged, LC, Gov Docs), returns a list of bibliographic records sorted by specific call number, starting with the call number searched (or the call number following closest). For Call Number searches set up to search specific call number types (i.e. Dewey Abridged, Dewey Unabridged, LC, Gov Docs), returns a list of bibliographic records sorted by specific call number, starting with the call number searched (or the call number following closest). For Call Number searches set up to search specific call number types (i.e. Dewey Abridged, Dewey Unabridged, LC, Gov Docs), returns a list of bibliographic records sorted by specific call number, starting with the call number searched (or the call number following closest). For Call Number searches set up to search specific call number types (i.e. Dewey Abridged, Dewey Unabridged, LC, Gov Docs), returns a list of bibliographic records sorted by specific call number, starting with the call number searched (or the call number following closest). Returns a list of bibliographic records sorted by item-level call number, starting with the call number searched (or the call number following closest). Returns an alphabetical listing of series headings showing the number of bibliographic records for each heading as well as authority information. Response also includes a follow on token for paging, as well as "Titles For Heading" tokens. Returns an alphabetical listing of subject headings showing the number of bibliographic records for each heading as well as authority information. Response also includes a follow on token for paging, as well as "Titles For Heading" tokens. Returns a list of bibliographic records sorted by title, starting with the phrase searched (or the title following closest to the phrase searched). Searches the CARL BID (Bibliographic Identifier), the unique number assigned to a bibliographic record as it enters your CARL database. Quick Search Commands are available for all search types and can be used to bypass the selection of a Search Type. Searches ISBN data from bibliographic tag 020 and Acquisitions orders. Searches ISSN data from bibliographic tag 022 and Acquisitions orders. Searches all words that appear in bibliographic records. Searches LCCN data from bibliographic tag 010. Searches number data in bibliographic records, including OCLC Control Number. Searches words in name headings without regard to word order. Returns an alphabetical list of headings showing the number of associated bibliographic records, authority information, and "Titles For Heading" tokens. Searches words from name headings, combined with words from bibliographic records. Searches words in series headings without regard to word order. Returns a list of bibliographic records where the search terms entered are found in a Series Heading that has been indexed for searching. Searches words in series headings without regard to word order. Returns an alphabetical list of those headings showing the number of associated bibliographic records, authority information and "Titles For Heading" tokens. Searches words in subject headings without regard to word order. Returns a list of bibliographic records where the search terms entered are found in a Subject Heading that has been indexed for searching. Searches words in subject headings without regard to word order. Returns an alphabetical list of those headings showing the number of associated bibliographic records, authority information, and "Titles For Heading" tokens. Searches title data in bibliographic records without regard to word order. Utilizing a token generated by searches that lead to authority data, retrieves bibliographic records associated with a given authority record. This element contains all the available patron searches<br/><br/> This element contains the basic available patron searches<br/><br/> This element contains the available catalog information search types<br/><br/>
DateLimit: Limits the search results to those that match the given date criteria

BranchLimit: Limits the search results to those that match the given branch(es)

FormatLimit: Limits the search results to those that match the given format(s)

LanguageLimit: Limits the search results to those that match the given language(s)

]]> Limits the search results to those that match the given date criteria Limits the search results to those that match the given branch(es) Limits the search results to those that match the given format(s) Limits the search results to those that match the given language(s)
DateFilter: The criteria on which to compare the dates in the results

Date: The date as a 4-digit year which can be appear either once or twice depending on whether the date filter is a range or not

]]> The criteria on which to compare the dates in the results The date as a 4-digit year which can be appear either once or twice depending on whether the date filter is a range or not The types of date limiting. Between requires 2 dates. None requires 0 dates. All others require 1.<br/><br/> Filters on results that are Equal to the given date Filters on results that are Between the given dates (inclusive) Filters on results that are Before the given date Filters on results that are After the given date No date filter is applied to results The types of search applications.<br/><br/>
BranchName: Name of the library branch

BranchNumber: Unique number assigned to the branch

OwningBranchCode: Up to 6-character code assigned to a physical branch of the library that owns the item

OwningBranchName: Name of the library branch that owns the item

OwningBranchNumber: Unique number assigned to the branch that owns the item

Suppress: Is the item suppress or not

Type: Indicates whether an item record originated in Circulation or Acquisitions

ThereAtLeastOneNote: Indicates if there are notes

Notes: Any Notes tied to the item

Status: Current Status of the item

StatusDate: Date the item's status changed

DueDate: Date the item is due or not needed

CreationDate: Date the item record was created (or converted)

EditDate: Date the item was last edited

CallNumberFull: Formatted call number

CNLabels: Labels for the 4 call number buckets

Caption: Four 1-character fields that identify an issue

Number: Third call number bucket

Part: Second call number bucket

Volume: First call number bucket

Suffix: Fourth call number bucket

ISID: Unique issue identification number

Chronology: Date of an issue

Enumeration: Enumerated value broken into four 5-byte fields, identifing an issue

CircHistory: # of times item has been charged/renewed since counter last re-set

CumulativeHistory: Number of times item has been charged/renewed since its creation

HoldsHistory: Number of times item has gone to Hold Shelf status since counter set

InHouseCirc: # of times item has been returned with an on shelf status since counter last re-set

Price: Price of item

ReserveBranchCode: Up to 6-character code assigned to a physical branch of the library that reserve the item

ReserveType: The Reserve Type

ReserveBranchLocation: The reserve branch location

ReserveCallNumber: Item-level call number, variously derived

]]>
BranchCode: Up to 6-character code assigned to a physical branch of the library

LocationCode: The location

MediaCode: The media type

BID: The ID of the bibliographic record

CallNumber: Item-level call number, variously derived

]]> This element contains the available item search types<br/><br/>
NoteType: The Note Type

NoteText: Text information

NoteDate: Indicates when the note was created or edited

Alias: Alias of the last staff member to create or edit

]]> This field contains the available ReserveTypes<br/> This field contains the available NoteTypes<br/> AltId: The alternate ID for the Patron
FirstName: The first name of the Patron
MiddleName: The middle name of the Patron
LastName: The last name of the Patron
PatronType: The type of the Patron
PatronStatusCode: The status of the Patron
Addresses: A list of addresses belonging to the Patron
UserDefinedFields: UDFs of the Patron
LastActionDate: The Last Date the Patron was Active
This element contains fields for the Patron element
PreferredAddress: The Preferred address for a Patron
SuffixName: The name suffix of a Patron
BirthDate: The birth date of the Patron
Phone1: The primary phone number of the Patron
Phone2: The secondary phone number of the Patron
PhoneType: The primary phone type of the Patron
EmailNotices: Enumeration indicating how to send email notices of the Patron
Email: The email address of the Patron
EmailReceiptFlag: Boolean value that indicates whether a user would like to receive email receipts for items checked out or renewed via the email address saved in their account. true = Opted-in, false = Opted-out
RegistrationDate: Date the Patron was registered
ExpirationDate: Date the Patron will expire
LastEditDate: Date the Patron was last edited
LastEditedBy: The user that last edited the Patron
Language: Language of the User for notices
RegBranch: The Branch where the Patron registered
DefaultBranch: The primary Brnach for the Patron
LastEditBranch: The Branch where the most recent account edit occurred for the Patron
PreferredBranch: The Branch the Patron prefers
LastActionBranch: The Branch where the most recent activity occurred
RegisteredBy: The user that registered the Patron
GeneralUserID: The general user id for the Patron
FullName: The full name of the Patron
PatronPIN: Personal identification number of the Patron
PINTimestamp: Modify date of PatronPIN
SelfServeActivityDate: Date the last self service activity occurred for the Patron
SponsorName: The name of the Sponsor for the Patron
SendHoldAvailableFlag: Boolean value that indicates whether a user would like to receive SMS notification when an item has been placed on the holdshelf on their behalf and is available for pickup. Notices are sent using a combination of the primary phone and phone carrier saved in the patron account. true = Opted-in, false = Opted-out
SendComingDueFlag: Boolean value that indicates whether a user would like to receive SMS notification when a checked out item/items are coming due. Notices are sent using a combination of the primary phone and phone carrier saved in the patron account. true = Opted-in, false = Opted-out
CollectionStatus: A system generated status that indicates whether a patron has been sent to Unique Management for collection of past due funds. 1 = Not Send; 2 = Sent; 78 = Do Not Send
LastActionLetterStatus: Value indicating whether a patron has received a Last Action Letter. N = Not Sent, I = In Process, S = Sent
LoanHistoryOptInFlag: Boolean value that indicates whether a patron wants to store and view loan history true = Opted-in, false = Opted-out
LoanHistoryStaffViewOptIn: Boolean value that indicates whether Staff can view patron loan history. Viewing patron loan history is only possible if LoanHistoryOptInFlag is also set to true. true = Opted-in, false = Opted-out
LegalName: The legal name of the Patron
]]> Address UserDefinedField This field contains the available Address types<br/> This field contains the available preferredAddress Types<br/> This field contains the available emailNotice Types<br/> This field contains the available PatronFlags<br/> This element contains fields for a Address element<br/> Street: The street of the Address<br/> City: The city of the Address<br/> State: The state of the Address<br/> PostalCode: The zip code of the Address<br/> The types of possible patron attributes for searching.<br/><br/> This field contains the available Collection Status types<br/> This field contains the available Last Action Letter Status types<br/> The types of possible patron attributes for searching.<br/><br/>

con:call.con:request: <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:cir="http://tlcdelivers.com/cx/schemas/circulationAPI" xmlns:req="http://tlcdelivers.com/cx/schemas/request">\r <soapenv:Header/>\r <soapenv:Body>\r <cir:CheckoutItemRequest>\r <!--You may enter the following 7 items in any order-->\r <cir:PatronSearchType>Patron ID</cir:PatronSearchType>\r <cir:PatronSearchID>11982021684457</cir:PatronSearchID>\r <cir:ItemID>21982319643890</cir:ItemID>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <cir:DueDate>2022-03-15</cir:DueDate>\r <cir:Alias>wb0</cir:Alias>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <cir:Override></cir:Override>\r <cir:Modifiers>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <req:InstitutionCode></req:InstitutionCode>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <req:StationID></req:StationID>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <req:StaffID></req:StaffID>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <req:EnvBranch></req:EnvBranch>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <req:DebugMode>true</req:DebugMode>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <req:ReportMode>false</req:ReportMode>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <req:Projection>Brief</req:Projection>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <req:RequestOrigin></req:RequestOrigin>\r </cir:Modifiers>\r </cir:CheckoutItemRequest>\r </soapenv:Body>\r </soapenv:Envelope>

con:call.con:request: <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:cir="http://tlcdelivers.com/cx/schemas/circulationAPI" xmlns:req="http://tlcdelivers.com/cx/schemas/request">\r <soapenv:Header/>\r <soapenv:Body>\r <cir:CheckoutItemRequest>\r <!--You may enter the following 7 items in any order-->\r <cir:PatronSearchType>?</cir:PatronSearchType>\r <cir:PatronSearchID>?</cir:PatronSearchID>\r <cir:ItemID>?</cir:ItemID>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <cir:DueDate>?</cir:DueDate>\r <cir:Alias>?</cir:Alias>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <cir:Override>?</cir:Override>\r <cir:Modifiers>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <req:InstitutionCode>?</req:InstitutionCode>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <req:StationID>?</req:StationID>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <req:StaffID>?</req:StaffID>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <req:EnvBranch>?</req:EnvBranch>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <req:DebugMode>?</req:DebugMode>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <req:ReportMode>?</req:ReportMode>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <req:Projection>Brief</req:Projection>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <req:RequestOrigin>?</req:RequestOrigin>\r </cir:Modifiers>\r </cir:CheckoutItemRequest>\r </soapenv:Body>\r </soapenv:Envelope>
